required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Clinical Trial of CT0180 Cells in the Treatment of Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Dose Escalation/Dose Exploration, Phase I Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Single/Multiple Infusion of CT0180 Injection in Patients With Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase I Clinical Study ofCT0180 cells in Patients with Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objectives:
Evaluate the safety and tolerance of CT0180 cells in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma within 28 days after the first infusion
Secondary objectives:
- Evaluate the metabolic kinetics of CT0180 cells ; · Evaluate overall safety and tolerability ; · Evaluate the initial efficacy of CT0180 cell infusion in the treatment of advanced hepatocellular carcinoma with positive Glypican-3（GPC3 ）expression.

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse Event of Special Interest （ AESI）

secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetics is the "Implantation endpoint" which is defined as the number of copies of the CT0180 DeoxyriboNucleic Acid（DNA）in peripheral blood detected at each visit after infusion until any two consecutive test results are negative or below the detection limit. Duration of CT0180 Cell persistence is the period from the day of infusion to the first negative test result or result lower than the detection limit

The number of cases in which tumor size is reduced to partial response (PR) or complete response (CR) / the total number of evaluable cases (%). In the event of partial response( PR) or complete response (CR), the subjects should confirm it no less than 4 weeks after the first evaluation
The period from the first evaluation of complete response ( CR) or partial response (PR) to the first evaluation of progressive disease (PD)or death of any cause.
The period from the day when the subject receives the first study treatment to the first recorded tumor progression (whether treated or not) or death of any cause, which occurs first
The period from the first study treatment to any cause of death
The number of cases in which response (PR + CR) and stable disease (SD) are achieved from the start of cell infusion/the total number of evaluable cases (%).
The period from the first evaluation of CR, PR, or SD to the first evaluation of PD or any cause of death

arm_group.description: CT0180 Cells infusion after lymphocyte-depleting with fludarabine and cyclophosphamide.

intervention.description: Five dose levels were tentatively determined.
intervention.other_name: CT0180 humanized anti GPC3 autogenous T Cell injection

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University
